Manx: Arrane
English: A Song
Diplomatic: Arrane

Manx: Yn fastyr aalin shoh ta gerjagh mee
English: This beautiful afternoon that comforts me,
Diplomatic: Yn fastyr aalin shoh ta gherjagh mee

Manx: Tra ta’n gheay wooar goaill shee
English: When the the great wind eases.
Diplomatic: Tra ta yn gheay wooar ghoaill shee

Manx: As ushagyn ta jannoo kiaull
English: And birds are making music,
Diplomatic: As ushagyn tha jannoo cchiaul

Manx: Tra ta’d çheet reesht er gys nyn oayll
English: When they come back to their habitat.
Diplomatic: Tra ta’d cheet reesht er gys nyn oayll

Manx: Ta’n ghrian ersooyl sheese ayns yn sheer
English: The sun is away down in the west,
Diplomatic: Ta’n ghrian ersooyl sheese ayns yn sheer

Manx: Fo bodjalyn dy chullyr keear
English: Under dark coloured clouds.
Diplomatic: Fo bodjalyn dy cullyr keer

Manx: Ta’n druigh nish shilley voish yn aer
English: The dew is now precipitating from the sky,
Diplomatic: Ta’n druigh nish shilley voish yn aer

Manx: As ooraghey yn joan as faiyr
English: And freshening the dust and grass.
Diplomatic: As ooaraghey yn jhon as faiyr

Manx: Ta’n lossey ghreiney nish ersooyl
English: The flame of the sun is now gone,
Diplomatic: Ta’n lossey ghrainey nish ersooyl

Manx: As te feer taitnysagh dy hooyl
English: And it is very pleasing to walk,
Diplomatic: As te feer taitnysagh dy hooyl

Manx: Dy akin yindysyn yn Çhiarn
English: To see see the wonders of the Lord
Diplomatic: Dy akin yindysyn yn Chiarn

Manx: Ren ad y chummey ayns dagh ayrn
English: That made them in every part.
Diplomatic: Ren ad y chummey ayns dagh ayrn

Manx: Hiarn ta mee yeearree dy chur booise
English: Lord, I want to give thanks,
Diplomatic: Hiarn ta mee yeeree dy chur booise

Manx: Er son ny bannaghtyn ta wheesh.
English: For the blessings that are so much.
Diplomatic: Er son ny bannaghtyn ta wheesh

Manx: Ta’n imbagh aalin gerjagh mee
English: The beautiful season comforts me,
Diplomatic: Ta’n imbagh aalin gherjagh mee

Manx: As jannoo boggey da my chree
English: And makes my heart rejoice.
Diplomatic: As jannoo boggey da my chree

Manx: Booise dy row Hood er son dy bragh
English: Thanks be to You for ever,
Diplomatic: Booise dy row hooid er son dy braa

Manx: Yn Jee shen ta fegooish caghlaa
English: That unchanging God,
Diplomatic: Yn Jee shen ta fegoish caghlaa

Manx: As va cha graighagh orrin hene
English: And who was so loving to us,
Diplomatic: As va cha ghraighagh orryn hene

Manx: Tra va shin ayns nyn beccaghyn
English: When we were in our sins.
Diplomatic: Tra va shin ayns nyn beccaghyn

Manx: O, cur dou cree ta kuine as meen
English: O, give me a heart that is calm and gentle,
Diplomatic: O cur dow chree ta kuin as meen

Manx: Sheel, myr ta yn cree Ayd Hene,
English: Sober, as Your Own heart is.
Diplomatic: Shuail mor ta yn chree ayd Hene

Manx: As myr yn immyr aalin feagh,
English: And like the beautiful allotment at rest,
Diplomatic: As mor yn imbyr aalin feagh

Manx: Ny lhig dou ve ny smoo anveagh.
English: Don’t let me be troublesome anymore.
Diplomatic: Ny lhig dow ve ny smoo anveagh

Manx: My Hiarn cur grayse dou dy hreishteil
English: Give me grace my Lord to trust,
Diplomatic: My Hiarn cur graase dow dy chreisteil

Manx: Son ta my chree as niart faileil
English: For my heart and might is failing.
Diplomatic: Son ta my chree as niart falleeil

Manx: O, Jean Uss reill mee er çheusthie
English: O, Rule me inside,
Diplomatic: O jean Uss reil mee er cheustie

Manx: Gys ver Oo lesh my annym thie.
English: Until You bring my soul home.
Diplomatic: Gus cer Oo lesh my annym thie

Manx: Yn daa laa yeig jeh mee veanagh yn Tourey, ayns yn vlein hoght cheead jeig kaire feed as nuy jeig.
English: The twelfth of June, in the year eight hundred and ninety-nine.
Diplomatic: Yn daa laa yeig jeh mee veanagh yn theurey. ayns yn velin hoght cheead yeig kair feed as niee jeig.

Manx: Farquhar
English: Farquhar.
Diplomatic: Farquhar
